definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Do you have steamed bun and shoes?
sentences.chinese: 你有蒸发小面包和鞋子吗？

sentences.english: She bought a loaf of brown bread and five currant buns .
sentences.chinese: 她买了一方黑面包和五个有葡萄干的小面包。

sentences.english: Wonder Light Enriched Buns, for example, are also loaded with calcium propionate.
sentences.chinese: 例如，他们的含麸皮的小面包，也添加了丙酸钙。

sentences.english: We bake bread and cake in an oven.
sentences.chinese: 我现在要为特蕾西烤几个小面包。

sentences.english: People got the sausages on buns, a special bread.
sentences.chinese: 人们买了香肠夹在一种特制的小面包里。

sentences.english: Buns marked with a cross were eaten by the Saxons to honour a goddess.
sentences.chinese: 撒克逊人把小面包做成十字形的也是为了向神致敬。

sentences.english: Why hasn't even the bun become speckled with mould?
sentences.chinese: 为什么即使是小面包也没有霉点呢？

sentences.english: I will bake Tracy several buns now.
sentences.chinese: 我现在要为特蕾西烤几个小面包。

definition: sachima, sweet (Manchu) pastry made of fried strips of dough coated with syrup, pressed together, then cut into blocks
